title: Zhenkun Li
text: Researcher Department of Civil Engineering Aalto University, Finland.

title: Zhenkun Li
text:
Research Interests
 Structural Health Monitoring (SHM)
Damage detection, Model updating, modal identification.
 Vehicle-bridge Interaction (VBI)
Vehicle scanning method, Weigh-in-motion (WIM), Vehicular parameter identification, Road roughness estimation.
 Machine Learning
Bayesian statistics, Gaussian processes, Deep learning, Computer vision, Transfer learning, Physics-informed neural networks (PINNs).

title: Zhenkun Li
text:
News and updates
 July 21, 2023. Together with Dr. Mario Puppio, Dr. Marco Tanganelli, and Dr. Filippo Landi, we are managing a special issue entitled “Evaluation of Buildings’ and Infrastructures’ Performance and Analysis of Seismic and Naturally Induced Disasters” in the journal of Applied Sciences (IF=2.7). Research on new design strategies, modern architectural and structural concepts for the new structures, machine learning, innovation in material technology or construction chain, or the retrofit of the ancient and traditional structures will be considered for publication.
 July 20, 2023. The paper “High-Fidelity Time-Series Data Synthesis based on Finite Element Simulation and Data Space Mapping”(link will be soon available) authored by Youqi Zhang, myself, Rui Hao, Weiwei Lin, Lingfang Li and Di Su is accepted by Mechanical Systems and Signal Processing. In this paper, I was responsible for Finite Element Modeling using Abaqus driven by Python. One interested in this paper can find its preprint version in Publications.
 July 2-6, 2023. I am attending IALCCE 2023 in Milano, Italy. More pictures can be found HERE. Thanks, all friends, for the interesting topics and nice dinner.
 June 15, 2023. My paper “Bridge Frequency Scanning Using the Contact-Point Response of an Instrumented 3D Vehicle: Theory and Numerical Simulation” co-authored with Weiwei Lin and Youqi Zhang is accepted by Structural Control and Health Monitoring.
 June 8, 2023. My paper “Indirect damage identification for bridges using passing and temporarily parked vehicles” co-authored with Yifu Lan and Weiwei Lin is accepted by Engineering Structures.
 April 6, 2023. Zhenkun Li was awarded an incentive grant in Fabian and Jaakko Ahvenainen Foundation grants awarded for the year 2022.

title: Zhenkun Li
text:
Research purposes



Our infrastructures, especially bridges, were built in the last century and are prone to deterioration and exposed to environmental hazards. My research aims to monitor the health conditions of infrastructures via system identification, uncertainty quantification, interaction between bridges and vehicles, and the cutting-edge Artificial Intelligence (AI) techniques. If you are interested in my background and intend to cooperate with me, please contact me at zhenkun.li@aalto.fi.

title: About me
text:
If you are interested in structural health monitoring (SHM), vehicle-bridge interaction (VBI), and machine learning, and intend to cooperate with me, please contact me at zhenkun.li@aalto.fi.

Zhenkun Li is a Researcher at the Department of Civil Engineering at Aalto University. He received his M.Eng. in School of Civil Engineering from Dalian University of Technology, China. His research interests lie in the Structural Health Monitoring (SHM) for civil infrastructure systems, damage detection, finite element analysis, deep learning and computer vision.

title: Research
text:
Projects

National Natural Science Foundation of China (NSFC), grant number 51878118, Structural damage identification and experiment study of slab track based on adding virtual physical parameters, 01/2019-12/2022, 680,000 RMB, ongoing, as main student investigator.
Health monitoring of the Xinghai Bridge’s suspension cable, 07-09/2018, as investigator.
Numerical simulation of damage identification of Dongying large-span bridge, 09-12/2018.
Damage detection of the plane frame structure, 03-07/2018.
Study on mechanical properties of SMA-rolling disc spring isolation bearing, 06/2014-09/2015, 3000RMB,as leader.
National Mathematical modeling competition, Positional calculation technology based on the sun shadow, 07/2015.
